org.forgerock.openidm.repo.orientdb.impl.query

Class Queries

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openidm.repo.orientdb.impl.query.Queries

  • public class Queries
extends Object
    Configured and add-hoc query support on OrientDB Queries can contain tokens of the format ${token-name}

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected org.forgerock.openidm.repo.orientdb.impl.query.QueryInfo prepareQuery(String queryString)
      Construct a prepared statement from the query String The constructed prepared query can only be verified at query execution time and hence the query execution may later fall back onto non-prepared execution

      protected com.orientechnologies.orient.core.sql.query.OSQLSynchQuery<com.orientechnologies.orient.core.record.impl.ODocument> resolveQuery(String queryString, Map<String,String> params)
      Resolve the query string which can contain %{token} tokens to a fully resolved query Doing the resolution ourselves means it can not be a prepared statement with tokens that gets re-used, but it allows us to replace more parts of the query than just the where clause.

      Set the pre-configured queries, which are identified by a query identifier and can be invoked using this identifier Success to set the queries does not mean they are valid as some can only be validated at query execution time.

    • Constructor Detail

        public Queries()

    • Method Detail

      • query

        public List<com.orientechnologies.orient.core.record.impl.ODocument> query(String type,
                                                                  org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryRequest request,
                                                                  com.orientechnologies.orient.core.db.document.ODatabaseDocumentTx database)
                                                                    throws org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException
        Execute a query, either a pre-configured query by using the query ID, or a query expression passed as part of the params. The keys for the input parameters as well as the return map entries are in QueryConstants.
        Parameters:
        type - the relative/local resource name, which needs to be converted to match the OrientDB document class name
        request - the query request, including parameters which include the query id, or the query expression, as well as the token key/value pairs to replace in the query
        database - a handle to a database connection instance for exclusive use by the query method whilst it is executing.
        Returns:
        The query result, which includes meta-data about the query, and the result set itself.
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed request parameters are invalid, e.g. missing query id or query expression or tokens.

      • setConfiguredQueries

        public void setConfiguredQueries(Map<String,String> queries)
        Set the pre-configured queries, which are identified by a query identifier and can be invoked using this identifier Success to set the queries does not mean they are valid as some can only be validated at query execution time.
        Parameters:
        queries - the complete list of configured queries, mapping from query id to the query expression which may optionally contain tokens in the form ${token-name}.

      • queryIdExists

        public boolean queryIdExists(String queryId)
        Check if a queryId is present in the set of configured queries.
        Parameters:
        queryId - Id of the query to check for
        Returns:
        true if the queryId is present in the set of configured queries.

      • resolveQuery

        protected com.orientechnologies.orient.core.sql.query.OSQLSynchQuery<com.orientechnologies.orient.core.record.impl.ODocument> resolveQuery(String queryString,
                                                                                                                               Map<String,String> params)
                                                                                                                                    throws org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException
        Resolve the query string which can contain %{token} tokens to a fully resolved query Doing the resolution ourselves means it can not be a prepared statement with tokens that gets re-used, but it allows us to replace more parts of the query than just the where clause.
        Parameters:
        queryString - The query with tokens
        params - THe parameters to replace the tokens with
        Returns:
        the query with any found tokens replaced
        Throws:
        org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the queryString contains token missing from params

      • resolveInlineQuery

        protected org.forgerock.openidm.repo.orientdb.impl.query.QueryInfo resolveInlineQuery(String type,
                                                                          String queryExpression,
                                                                          com.orientechnologies.orient.core.db.document.ODatabaseDocumentTx database)
        Populate and prepare the query information with the query expression passed in the parameters
        Parameters:
        type - the relative/local resource name
        queryExpression - the parameters with the query expression and token replacement key/values
        database - a handle to a OrientDB db that is available for exclusive use during the invocation of this method
        Returns:
        the populated query info

      • prepareQuery

        protected org.forgerock.openidm.repo.orientdb.impl.query.QueryInfo prepareQuery(String queryString)
        Construct a prepared statement from the query String The constructed prepared query can only be verified at query execution time and hence the query execution may later fall back onto non-prepared execution
        Parameters:
        queryString - the query expression, including tokens to replace
        Returns:
        the constructed (but not validated) prepared statement
